Detailed Description

VoIP headset manager.

Attention

Version
01/16/2013 (mclouatre) First Version

Function Documentation

int32_t VoipHeadsetControl ( VoipHeadsetRefT *  pHeadset,
int32_t  iControl,
int32_t  iValue,
int32_t  iValue2,
void *  pValue 
)

Control function.

Parameters
*pHeadset- headset module state
iControl- control selector
iValue- control value
iValue2- control value
*pValue- control value
Returns
int32_t - selector specific, or -1 if no such selector
Note
iControl can be one of the following:
        '+pbk' - enable voice playback for a given remote user (pValue is the remote user VoipUserT).
        '-pbk' - disable voice playback for a given remote user (pValue is the remote user VoipUserT).
        'aloc' - activate/deactivate local user (enter/exit "participating" state)
        'epbs' - modified encoding bps generation configuration
        'loop' - enable/disable loopback
        'rloc' - register/unregister local user
        'spam' - debug verbosity level
Version
16/01/2013 (mclouatre)

References VoipHeadsetRefT::aRemoteUsers, VoipHeadsetRefT::bDecoderConnUpdateNeeded, VoipHeadsetRefT::bLoopback, FALSE, VoipHeadsetRefT::iMaxRemoteUsers, NetPrintf, VoipUserT::strUserId, TRUE, PS4RemoteVoipUserT::uEnablePlayback, PS4RemoteVoipUserT::user, VOIP_MAXLOCALUSERS, and VOIP_SameUser.

Referenced by VoipCommonControl(), and VoipControl().

VoipHeadsetRefT* VoipHeadsetCreate ( int32_t  iMaxChannels,
VoipHeadsetMicDataCbT *  pMicDataCb,
VoipHeadsetStatusCbT *  pStatusCb,
void *  pCbUserData,
int32_t  iAttr 
)

Create the headset manager.

Parameters
iMaxChannels- max number of remote users
*pMicDataCb- pointer to user callback to trigger when mic data is ready
*pStatusCb- pointer to user callback to trigger when headset status changes
*pCbUserData- pointer to user callback data
iAttr- platform-specific - use to specify the voice lib thread attributes on PS4
Returns
VoipHeadsetRefT * - pointer to module state, or NULL if an error occured
Note
        Valid value for iAttr:
        The higher 16 bit is the CPU Affinity value. The lower 16 bits is the scheduling priority.
        For example iAttr = (SCE_KERNEL_CPUMASK_USER_ALL << 16) | SCE_KERNEL_PRIO_FIFO_HIGHEST.
Version
16/01/2013 (mclouatre)

References VoipHeadsetRefT::cpuAffinity, DirtyMemAlloc(), DirtyMemFree(), VoipHeadsetRefT::iDecoderPoolSize, VoipHeadsetRefT::iEncoderBps, VoipHeadsetRefT::iMaxChannels, VoipHeadsetRefT::iMaxRemoteUsers, VoipHeadsetRefT::iSchedPriority, NetConnStatus(), NetPrintf, NetPrintfVerbose, NetTick(), NetTickDiff, VoipHeadsetRefT::pCbUserData, VoipHeadsetRefT::pDecoders, VoipHeadsetRefT::pMicDataCb, VoipHeadsetRefT::pStatusCb, VOIP_MAX_LOW_LEVEL_CONNS, VOIP_MAXCONNECT, VOIP_MEMID, VOIPHEADSET_VOICELIB_DEFAULT_ENCODER_BITRATE, and VoipMemGroupQuery().

int32_t VoipHeadsetStatus ( VoipHeadsetRefT *  pHeadset,
int32_t  iSelect,
int32_t  iValue,
void *  pBuf,
int32_t  iBufSize 
)

Status function.

Parameters
*pHeadset- headset module state
iSelect- control selector
iValue- selector specific
*pBuf- buffer pointer
iBufSize- buffer size
Returns
int32_t - selector specific, or -1 if no such selector
Note
iSelect can be one of the following:
        'camr' - return TRUE is the PS Camera Mic is in use.
        'ruid' - return TRUE if the given remote user (pBuf) is registered with voipheadset, FALSE if not.
        'sact' - return TRUE if shared device (PS Camera) is active
        'hpao' - return the audio device output flag for a given user index (iValue). IMPORTANT: value is not valid until something has been written to the outpout port
Version
16/01/2013 (mclouatre)

References VoipHeadsetRefT::aLocalUsers, VoipHeadsetRefT::aRemoteUsers, PS4LocalVoipUserT::bParticipating, DirtyErrGetName(), FALSE, VoipHeadsetRefT::iMaxRemoteUsers, NetPrintf, TRUE, VoipHeadsetRefT::uLastHeadsetStatus, PS4LocalVoipUserT::uMicPortId, PS4LocalVoipUserT::user, PS4RemoteVoipUserT::user, PS4LocalVoipUserT::uSpkrPortId, VOIP_MAXLOCALUSERS, VOIP_NullUser, and VOIP_SameUser.

Referenced by VoipCommonApplyChannelConfig(), VoipCommonStatus(), and VoipHeadsetProcess().
